page.title: 08Entertainment in Eccleshall
page.content: Although Eccleshall has no theatre or cinema, popular entertainment thrives from early days when children at the Lonsdale school are encouraged to participate in plays and concerts. This tradition is continued at the Middle School, where plays are per- formed regularly and carol services held in church every Christmas with readings by the pupils. Church con- certs are extremely poular with local residents, and are held often, enter- taining and raising money. Occasion- ally a professional organist is invit- ed to use the church's magnificent organ, but generally the musicians, singers and actors are local people; Eccleshall boasts soloists of dist- inction, both singers and instrument- alists. In addition various programmes are arranged by the Players, Singers, Handbell ringers + Barbershop Quartet.
